article_title: Kennametal to Buy Allegheny Technologies' Tungsten Business
article_text:
PITTSBURGH—Kennametal Inc. is buying Allegheny Technologies Inc.'s tungsten business for $605 million, a deal that sheds light on an obscure but important part of the metals business.

The two western Pennsylvania companies, each of which has a market value above $3 billion, buy scrap and other raw materials and process them into powder coatings, alloys and tools used by manufacturers of everything from mining drills to airplanes.

...

article_metadata.author: John W. Miller
article_metadata.article.origheadline: Kennametal to Buy Allegheny Technologies’ Tungsten Business

article_summary:
PITTSBURGH—Kennametal Inc. is buying Allegheny Technologies Inc.'s tungsten business for $605 million, a deal that sheds light on an obscure but important part of the metals business.
The two western Pennsylvania companies, each of which has a market value above $3 billion, buy scrap and other raw materials and process them into powder coatings, alloys and tools used by manufacturers of everything from mining drills to airplanes.
